subject: Leadership
title: Leadership vs. Management
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Leadership vs. Management.

hook.text: A manager makes sure the train runs on time. A leader asks whether it's heading to the right station.

buildup.text: Management focuses on systems, processes, and efficiency. Leadership focuses on vision, people, and change.

discovery.text: Peter Drucker said it best: management is doing things right, leadership is doing the right things.

twist.text: Great organizations need both. A visionary without systems creates chaos. Systems without vision create stagnation.

climax.text: The best leaders know when to manage and when to lead. Context determines which hat to wear.

punchline.text: Leaders set direction. Managers keep it moving. You need both.

quiz.question: What is the primary focus of leadership vs. management?
options: Vision and change vs. systems and efficiency
